item.title: Analysis
item.description: General Situation Analysis of data happens at different stages: automatic statistical analysis in the database analysis in the context of individual research questions Statistics of plots forest structure PlotBook Selection of fs-plot Are the plots randomly chosen and represent the mean of their surrounding? Neighbour trees

item.title: Description MOFgeoDB
item.description: General Setting The MOFgeoDB is a SQlite database using the spatial extension spatialite and serves our data of vegetation (mainly trees) and study plots for ecosystem research (forest structure, experiments) over time. Additional there are some auxiliary datasets (geopackage) of infrastructure for visual reasons. QGIS is used as back-end for analysis and visualization. Relational Structure First overview of the relational structure gives figure 1 Figure 1: Complete ER diagram of MOFgeoDB without creator table The database can be divided into following sections
